treevalues 0.1.0
  • Overview
  • Tutorial
  • Reference

Reference

Primary user functions

branchInference()

The main function for carrying out inference on an ``rpart`` regression tree. Can be used to carry out inference on a pair of sibling regions or on a single region.

treeval.plot()

This function allows users to plot their rpart object with all splits labeled with p-values and all nodes labeled with confidence intervals.

inferenceFrame()

This function can optionally be used prior to running ``treeval.plot`` to make ``treeval.plot`` run more efficiently.

getBranch()

Given an rpart tree and a node number, returns a vector of strings that describes the branch which defines the node.

getAllBranches()

Given an rpart tree, returns a list describing every branch in the tree. Useful for extracting individual branches, which are necessary inputs to ``branchInference()``.

Helper functions for working with trees

getAnc()

Returns vector of ancestors in ``tree`` for node ``nn``.

getDesc()

Returns vector of descendants in ``tree`` for node ``nn``.

getRegion()

Pass in a tree and a node number. This returns a vector of booleans identifying which members of the training set belong to the given region.

Selective Inference Functions

getInterval()

Workhorse function for computing conditioning sets.

correctPVal()

Get a pvalue for a selective Z-test using a truncated normal distribution.

computeCI()

Compute selective confidence interval for parameter v^T mu based on a truncated normal distribution. A slight modiication of code found in the Outference package, available at https://github.com/shuxiaoc/outference.

TNSurv()

Survival function of truncated normal distribution. This comes from the Outference Package https://github.com/shuxiaoc/outference.

TNProb()

Probability of a standard normal in a union of intervals
